column4: hi all....ok this has been a real pain with Hardy Wubi install: I have read/write access to the shared Windows partition only as root.  How can I get read/write file access from my regular user account?
or whatever your user id is from users and groups under administration
also add a comma and uid=1000   (or whatever your user id is)
hmmm...those numbers are not in my fstab file
should be something like this:   UUID=xxxxxxblah   /mountpoint    ntfs    blahblah,gid=47
see, it's all different because I haven't partitioned the hd, I just did the wubi install
should I try to post my fstab here???
ah. I don't know anything about wubi. don't post fstab here though. use the pastebin
that is one weird fstab. is your windows install on the same disk ?
yes, that's how wubi works, to the best of my knowledge.
like I said, I don't know anything about wubi, I installed from the CD .ISO before windows loaded. best to wait until someone else who knows can help rather than potentially screw something up.
Maybe I should go at this problem a different way.  What would cause the user account not to have read/write permission but would allow the root account to do so?
thanks for your thoughts - oh, and I guess changing the default behavior involves changing the fstab, right?
and that's what's weird about my fstab....*sigh* Thanks for your thoughts.
yes, the only way to take ownership of the partition and retain it on next restart is to edit fstab
